Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can illustrate a specific habitat, like a garden or pond, with relevant environmental features.
The student can depict a variety of plants within the chosen habitat, such as trees, grasses, or flowering plants.
The student can include several animals commonly found in the habitat, such as ants in a garden or fish in a pond.
The student can organize their drawing in a way that somewhat clearly shows the arrangement of living things within the habitat.
CANNOT: The student may inconsistently differentiate between habitats if more than one is shown (e.g., similar plants depicted in both land and water habitats).
The student might show minor gaps in illustrating the diversity of life or could omit less common species (e.g., fails to show clams in pond habitat).
The student may struggle to fully demonstrate patterns of similarity and difference across habitats (e.g., similar types of animals not shown distinctly).
The student might not clearly label all plant and animal types, leading to partial representation (e.g., a bush depicted but not labeled).
